intro: Toxylon pomiferum, commonly known as the desert date tree, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy fruits resembling dates. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Toxylon pomiferum is well adapted to harsh environments and is often used for its ornamental value and in traditional medicine.
